results.content:
---------------------------------- Türkçe ------------------------------------------
Angular 2'yi tam anlamıyla kavradım ve sıfırdan bir web sitesi oluşturdum. Takıldığım yerde sorular kısmından yararlandım ve ilerlemeye devam ettim. Benim için oldukça eğlenceli bir kurstu.

Ermin hoca, işinde gayet iyi apaçık ortada. Ders anlatışındaki samimiyet ve komik tepkiler kursu daha zevkli hale getirdi. 

Teşekkürler Ermin Kreponic...

---------------------------------- English --------------------------------------------------
I fully understood Angular 2 and have created a website from scratch. I used the Questions part in the place where I stuck and continued to the progress. It's a pretty fun ride for me.

Ermin the Instructor obviously well in his business. His sincerity and funny reactions in the lecture made the course more enjoyable. 

Thanks, Ermin Kreponic...
results.content_html:
---------------------------------- Türkçe ------------------------------------------
Angular 2'yi tam anlamıyla kavradım ve sıfırdan bir web sitesi oluşturdum. Takıldığım yerde sorular kısmından yararlandım ve ilerlemeye devam ettim. Benim için oldukça eğlenceli bir kurstu.

Ermin hoca, işinde gayet iyi apaçık ortada. Ders anlatışındaki samimiyet ve komik tepkiler kursu daha zevkli hale getirdi.

Teşekkürler Ermin Kreponic...

---------------------------------- English --------------------------------------------------
I fully understood Angular 2 and have created a website from scratch. I used the Questions part in the place where I stuck and continued to the progress. It's a pretty fun ride for me.

Ermin the Instructor obviously well in his business. His sincerity and funny reactions in the lecture made the course more enjoyable.

Thanks, Ermin Kreponic...

results.content: To be honest, I don't like the final parts, because the teacher have moved to fast where he just try to explain the complete code without doing the step by step so... I get very confused, but well, the last part about the pipes with Async it was so freaking confusing and interesting to the point that I need more material to understand searching with Google... and the another thing I don't like to much its doing all the course in the same project without doing another project to understand every part of Angular 2 in different projects to understand why or how, so every time I'm learning a new stuff in this course I needed to make a copy of the project and paste in a new folder to save the progress without getting confusing

results.content:
I completed the course but I need to use Google to search somethings because the course was made with an Angular 2 version not finished(in development state) and there are some changes with the final version also because the quick start project changed.

The instructor said in the first video that probably will be changes in Angular and yes there are some changes in Angular and in the Quick Start Project. Missing files, files in different locations, files with different content, some functions or classes deprecated/replaced, some declaration will be in different files, some declarations will be omitted so be ready to use Google to solve some errors.
results.content_html:
I completed the course but I need to use Google to search somethings because the course was made with an Angular 2 version not finished(in development state) and there are some changes with the final version also because the quick start project changed.

Missing files, files in different locations, files with different content, some functions or classes deprecated/replaced, some declaration will be in different files, some declarations will be omitted so be ready to use Google to solve some errors.

results.content:
Angular QuickStart used in this course is now deprecated and it is no longer possible to fulfill all the steps as of 2019. There also was not promised database at the end.

Up to services section this course is quite solid and this is a big plus. It covers the most important aspects of Angular 2 and instructor explains everything very well.

It is for sure an outdated course and it would be better if there was an update with Angular CLI or Angular 4+.
results.content_html:
Angular QuickStart used in this course is now deprecated and it is no longer possible to fulfill all the steps as of 2019. There also was not promised database at the end.

Up to services section this course is quite solid and this is a big plus. It covers the most important aspects of Angular 2 and instructor explains everything very well.

It is for sure an outdated course and it would be better if there was an update with Angular CLI or Angular 4+.

results.content:
From the very beginning you get a heads up: This is gonna be really really slow... The guy is downloading and installing everything in front of you eyes in REAL TIME! And he's explaining things like if you never used a computer in your life. 
Then it gets worse, the whole course is a loooooong explanation of each line, and he explains over and over again. You cannot learn Angular2 if you don't know anything about HTML and CSS, this course should obviously be for people who develop already but want to learn a new framework. It's boring to death. 
The worse is that is completely outdated, the github repo that he uses has now many more files and if you don't search a little bit for the old version, you'll get completely lost. Seems impossible for people who have a level that he thinks people have (ie very low). 
And when you go to the Q&A section, you can see that almost all the questions are unanswered. This course was maybe accurate once but it's been completely abandonned by the teacher. 
Overall, in order to learn something, you'll need a loooooot of patience to obtain the information that you need in an ocean of useless explanations.
results.content_html:
From the very beginning you get a heads up: This is gonna be really really slow... The guy is downloading and installing everything in front of you eyes in REAL TIME! And he's explaining things like if you never used a computer in your life.
Then it gets worse, the whole course is a loooooong explanation of each line, and he explains over and over again. You cannot learn Angular2 if you don't know anything about HTML and CSS, this course should obviously be for people who develop already but want to learn a new framework. It's boring to death.
The worse is that is completely outdated, the github repo that he uses has now many more files and if you don't search a little bit for the old version, you'll get completely lost. Seems impossible for people who have a level that he thinks people have (ie very low).
And when you go to the Q&A section, you can see that almost all the questions are unanswered. This course was maybe accurate once but it's been completely abandonned by the teacher.
Overall, in order to learn something, you'll need a loooooot of patience to obtain the information that you need in an ocean of useless explanations.

results.content:
I think you could use a little less time on the downloads... just show the links and use editing to cut the waiting, hope this help!

I know that is supposed to be a beginner tutorial but I think you can use a little less repeating, I believe that it would be better if you create additional material to explain complex subjects, not in the video tutorial but a different place: doc, wiki, youtube.

I don't know if there is an option to mark a video as optional, like the 2 chapters about Bootstrap, those videos didn't aggregate any value to Angular2.
results.content_html:
I think you could use a little less time on the downloads... just show the links and use editing to cut the waiting, hope this help!

I know that is supposed to be a beginner tutorial but I think you can use a little less repeating, I believe that it would be better if you create additional material to explain complex subjects, not in the video tutorial but a different place: doc, wiki, youtube.

I don't know if there is an option to mark a video as optional, like the 2 chapters about Bootstrap, those videos didn't aggregate any value to Angular2.

results.content:
I really think you should improve your engagement when teaching.
Also, reconsider structuring this course in a different fashion so it's easy for people that already know HTML and CSS can jump.
On the other hand, you spend time explaining fairly easy things like the js method splice() but new things that come​ with TS aren't mentioned at all.
results.content_html:
I really think you should improve your engagement when teaching.
Also, reconsider structuring this course in a different fashion so it's easy for people that already know HTML and CSS can jump.
On the other hand, you spend time explaining fairly easy things like the js method splice() but new things that come​ with TS aren't mentioned at all.

results.content:
Explains everything well. Only problem is that Angular Quickstart has obviously been updated since this course was made so is slightly different and the version used is no longer available on github. Saying that, if you have an understanding of it all you can still follow quite easily. 

If the course was updated ( or even a link to the version of Quickstart used ) I would prob give it 5 starts
results.content_html:

results.content:
I think everything is there, but 1) github quickstart app is outdated in the course, so the sources do not match (I have not been able to move sources to tmp/app, although I tried a few times), 2) the pace is very slow - the trainer is very verbose, sometimes in a few minutes you should guess what trainer is explaining for 10 minutes or more.
3) Annoying setup section including even firefox browser. Installation time of the tools is faster on my machine, a few cuts would be useful to keep student at the computer.

I definitely follow this course, but sometimes I am very impatient about the next step.
results.content_html:
I think everything is there, but 1) github quickstart app is outdated in the course, so the sources do not match (I have not been able to move sources to tmp/app, although I tried a few times), 2) the pace is very slow - the trainer is very verbose, sometimes in a few minutes you should guess what trainer is explaining for 10 minutes or more.
3) Annoying setup section including even firefox browser. Installation time of the tools is faster on my machine, a few cuts would be useful to keep student at the computer.

I definitely follow this course, but sometimes I am very impatient about the next step.
